In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can do this in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    res = ""
    for word in words
        if length(res) + length(word) > text_width
            res *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(res)
            res *= " "
        end
        res *= word
    end
    return res
end
```

You can test the function using this example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras vestibulum risus at purus imperdiet, ut viverra ante tempus. Vestibulum ac sapien dui. Suspendisse id lobortis orci.", 30))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras vestibulum risus at purus imperdiet, ut viverra ante tempus.
Vestibulum ac sapien dui. Suspendisse id lobortis orci.
```
